author: Pavan Dahat
text:
A six-member National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) team will visit Chhattisgarh on Tuesday to probe into the recent cases of atrocities on tribal women in the restive Bastar region of the State and the attacks and eviction of human rights lawyers and activists.

“A team comprising six NHRC members will visit Raipur, Bijapur, Sukma, Dantewada and Jagdalpur district headquarters of Bastar district from March 1. The team will look into the cases of alleged gang-rapes of tribal women in Bijapur district. We have received a complaint from Indrani Chakravarti from Jagdalpur Legal Aid group on the eviction of her colleagues from Bastar. The team will look into it,” Mr. Geminikumar Shrivastava, NHRC spokesperson, told The Hindu .
title: NHRC team to probe rights violation in Bastar
